an7.21:1.2: At one time the Buddha was staying near Vesālī, at the Sārandada Tree-shrine.
an7.21:1.3: Then several Licchavis went up to the Buddha, bowed, sat down to one side, and the Buddha said to these Licchavis:
an7.21:1.4: “Licchavis, I will teach you these seven principles that prevent decline.
an7.21:1.5: Listen and pay close attention, I will speak.”
an7.21:2.1: “And what are the seven principles that prevent decline?
an7.21:2.2: As long as the Vajjis meet frequently and have many meetings,
an7.21:2.3: they can expect growth, not decline.
an7.21:3.1: As long as the Vajjis meet in harmony, leave in harmony, and carry on their business in harmony,
an7.21:3.2: they can expect growth, not decline.
an7.21:4.1: As long as the Vajjis don’t make new decrees or abolish existing decrees, but undertake and follow the traditional Vajjian principles as they have been decreed,
an7.21:4.2: they can expect growth, not decline.
an7.21:5.1: As long as the Vajjis honor, respect, esteem, and venerate Vajjian elders, and think them worth listening to,
an7.21:5.2: they can expect growth, not decline.
an7.21:6.1: As long as the Vajjis don’t rape or abduct women or girls from their families and force them to live with them,
an7.21:6.2: they can expect growth, not decline.
an7.21:7.1: As long as the Vajjis honor, respect, esteem, and venerate the Vajjian shrines, whether inner or outer, not neglecting the proper spirit-offerings that were given and made in the past,
an7.21:7.2: they can expect growth, not decline.
an7.21:8.1: As long as the Vajjis organize proper protection, shelter, and security for perfected ones, so that
an7.21:8.2: more perfected ones might come to the realm and those already here may live in comfort,
an7.21:8.3: they can expect growth, not decline.
an7.21:9.1: As long as these seven principles that prevent decline last among the Vajjis, and as long as the Vajjis are seen following them,
an7.21:9.2: they can expect growth, not decline.”
